channel.title: numpy on Dev Blog
channel.description: Recent content in numpy on Dev Blog

item.title: Array
item.description: In Python, an array is a data structure that stores a collection of elements of the same data type. Unlike lists, which can contain elements of different data types, arrays can only contain elements of a single data type, such as integers, floats, or characters. Python supports two types of arrays: arrays provided by the built-in array module and arrays provided by the numpy module. built-in array module The array module provides a simple way to create and manipulate arrays of primitive data types, such as integers, floats, and characters.
